title: Remove AskUserQuestion confirmation gates from subagent workflows
description: Subagents currently have instructions to use AskUserQuestion tool to confirm their plan before execution. Remove these confirmation requirements to allow subagents to execute autonomously without user approval gates.

title: Refactor system-prompt.md to be lightweight index
description: Reduce system-prompt.md to coordination/routing logic only. Extract phase-specific instructions to collaboration skills. Extract detailed protocols to process files. Make system-prompt.md primarily an index pointing to skills and process files for specific behaviors.
design:
Current system-prompt.md is very large with phase-specific instructions embedded. Should instead:

- Keep: Main agent role (coordinator), workflow gates, phase sequence
- Keep: When to call which skill or agent (routing logic)
- Keep: Critical protocols (git, dependencies, temporal anchoring)
- Move to skills: Phase-specific collaboration instructions
- Move to process files: Detailed methodologies already extracted (TDD, Event Modeling, etc.)

Result: Lighter context usage, easier maintenance, clearer separation of concerns.

title: Update process files to reference collaboration model
description: Update existing process files (EVENT_MODELING.md, TDD_WORKFLOW.md, DOMAIN_MODELING.md, etc.) to reference collaboration-first model. Add sections on QUESTION: comments, IDE diff modification flow, and how phases work collaboratively rather than autonomously.
design:
Process files to update:
- EVENT_MODELING.md: Add collaboration protocols for each step
- TDD_WORKFLOW.md: Update red/green phases for collaborative implementation
- DOMAIN_MODELING.md: Emphasize collaborative type design
- STORY_PLANNING.md: Add collaborative story refinement protocols
- ADR_TEMPLATE.md: Update for collaborative ADR creation

Each should reference how main conversation facilitates user participation using QUESTION: comments and diff modification.

title: Collaboration-first architecture with main conversation orchestration
description: Convert agent-based workflows to Claude Code skills to maintain context across interactions. Implement memory-first approach where research subagents record insights in memento and return summaries, while main conversation uses memento proactively without context pollution.
design:
ALL creative/decision work must happen collaboratively in the main conversation with user participation. Agents serve as advisory/research support only, returning recommendations rather than finished artifacts.

Core principles:
- User participates in requirements, event modeling, architecture, planning, and coding
- No rubber-stamp approval of autonomous agent outputs
- QUESTION: comment mechanism for inline queries during collaboration
- IDE diff modification flow where user edits proposals and main conversation acknowledges/counterargues
- Agents can research, analyze, structure, recommend - but main conversation facilitates user collaboration on implementation

title: Create memory-search skill for querying memento graph
description: Create a Claude Code skill that searches memento memories and traverses the knowledge graph. Returns processed relevant memories to main conversation without re-recording. Can update graph with new semantic connections between previously disconnected memories.

title: Ensure research-specialist agent is advisory-only (no file edits)
description: Convert agents that do research and exploration (codebase-explorer, research-specialist, etc.) to Claude Code skills. These skills should record insights in memento and return only relevant summaries to main conversation to avoid context pollution.
notes: codebase-explorer is already a skill (correct). research-specialist should remain an agent but be strictly advisory - research/recommend only, no file modifications. Returns findings to main conversation for collaborative implementation.

title: Update main conversation agent to proactively use memento
description: Modify main conversation agent instructions to proactively query and record memories in memento throughout work sessions. Should leverage memory-search skill for retrieving relevant context.

title: Create phase-specific collaboration skills for SDLC workflow
description: Convert workflow-specific agents (requirements-analyst, story-planner, adr-writer, etc.) to Claude Code skills to maintain context across interactions and prevent amnesia between invocations.
design:
Phase-specific skills needed:
- requirements-collaboration: Guide collaborative requirement capture
- event-modeling-collaboration: Guide collaborative event model design  
- architecture-collaboration: Guide collaborative ADR creation
- story-planning-collaboration: Guide collaborative story breakdown
- tdd-collaboration: Guide collaborative test/code writing

Each skill contains protocols for QUESTION: comments, IDE diff modification acknowledgment, and iterative refinement with user.
notes: NOT about converting existing agents to skills. About creating NEW skills that guide how main conversation collaborates with user during each SDLC phase. Original description was misleading.

title: Define skill vs subagent decision criteria
description: Document clear criteria for when to use skills (context preservation needed) vs subagents (research/exploration that generates noise). Update architecture documentation with decision tree.

title: Document collaboration protocols and agent permissions
description: Create process documentation defining how main conversation collaborates with user on all creative work. Document QUESTION: comment mechanism, IDE diff modification flow, when agents can/cannot edit files, and how main conversation acknowledges user changes.

title: Audit all existing agents and remove file-edit permissions from advisory agents
description: Review every agent in .claude/agents/ directory. Categorize each as: (1) Advisory-only (research/recommend, no file edits), (2) Keep as autonomous (purely mechanical work), or (3) Remove/consolidate. Update agent definitions to remove Write/Edit/NotebookEdit permissions from advisory agents.
design:
Advisory agents (remove Write/Edit permissions):
- research-specialist
- TDD agents (red-tdd-tester, green-implementer)
- Domain modeling agents (rust/python/typescript/elixir-domain-model-expert)
- Planning agents (requirements-analyst, story-planner, adr-writer, story-architect, ux-consultant)
- Event modeling agents (all 13 step agents)

Autonomous agents (keep file permissions - purely mechanical):
- technical-documentation-writer (formatting/consistency only)
- devops (infrastructure configuration)
- file-editor (direct user requests only)

Document rationale for each categorization.
